chú thích tập san học thuật.{{chú thích tập san học thuật|author: [[Viện Hàn lâm Khoa học xã hội Việt Nam|Viện Khoa học Xã hội Việt Nam]]|name-list-style=|date=|year=2003|orig-date=|editor=|display-editors=|others=|title=Tạp chí Viet Nam Social Sciences (Khoa học Xã hội Việt Nam)|script-title=|trans-title=|url=|format=|department=|journal=Viet Nam Social Sciences|type=|series=|language=en|edition=|location=|publisher=|publication-place=|publication-date=|volume=1-6|issue=|page=91|pages=|doi=|doi-access=|doi-broken-date=|isbn=|issn=|id=|url-access=|access-date=|url-status=|archive-url=|archive-date=|quote=In 111 B.C. there prevailed a historical personage of the name of Tay Vu Vuong who took advantage of troubles circumstances in the early period of Chinese domination to raise his power, and finally was killed by his general assistant, Hoang Dong. Professor Tran Quoc Vuong saw in him the Tay Vu chief having in hands tens of thousands of households, governing thousands miles of land and establishing his center in Co Loa area (59.239). Tay Vu and Tay Au is in fact the same.}}
